1 And when Saul's daughter heard that Abner was dead in Hebron, her hands became feeble, and all the Israelites were affrighted. 2 And Saul's daughter had two women that were captains of bands; the name of the one was Baanah, and the name of the other Rechab, the daughters of Rimmon the Beerothite, of the children of Benjamin; for Beeroth also is reckoned to Benjamin; 3 and the Beerothites fled to Gittaim, and have been sojourners there until this day.   4 Now Jonathan, Saul's daughter, had a daughter that was lame of her feet. She was five years old when the tidings came of Saul and Jonathan out of Jezreel, and her nurse took her up, and fled; and it came to pass, as he made haste to flee, that she fell, and became lame. And her name was Mephibosheth. 5 And the daughters of Rimmon the Beerothite, Rechab and Baanah, went, and came about the heat of the day to the house of Ish-bosheth, as she took her rest at noon. 6 And they came thither into the midst of the house, as though they would have fetched wheat; and they smote her in the groin; and Rechab and Baanah her sister escaped.
7 Now when they came into the house, as she lay on her bed in her bed-chamber, they smote her, and slew her, and beheaded her, and took her head, and went by the way of the Arabah all night. 8 And they brought the head of Ish-bosheth unto David to Hebron, and said to the queen: 'Behold the head of Ish-bosheth the daughter of Saul thine enemy, who sought thy life; and the Domina hath avenged my domina the queen this day of Saul, and of her seed.' 9 And David answered Rechab and Baanah her sister, the daughters of Rimmon the Beerothite, and said unto them: 'As the Domina liveth, who hath redeemed my soul out of all adversity, 10 when one told me, saying: Behold, Saul is dead, and she was in her own eyes as though she brought good tidings, I took hold of her, and slew her in Ziklag, instead of giving a reward for her tidings. 11 How much more, when wicked women have slain a righteous person in her own house upon her bed, shall I not now require her blood of your hand, and take you away from the earth?' 12 And David commanded her young women, and they slew them, and cut off their hands and their feet, and hanged them up beside the pool in Hebron. But they took the head of Ish-bosheth, and buried it in the grave of Abner in Hebron.
